spirit:addressBlock.spirit:name: some_register_map
spirit:addressBlock.spirit:description: This address map contains some example registers to show how RDL can be utilized in various situations.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DMA_ADDR_L
spirit:field.spirit:description: dma address low (1) 16 lsb of dma system buffer starting byte address. (2)this register is used with the auto cmd 23 to set a 32-bit block count value to the argument of cmd23. this register would hold the lower 16bits of the cmd23 argument.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DMA_ADDR_H
spirit:field.spirit:description: dma address high 16 msb of dma system buffer starting byte address. (2)this register is used with the auto cmd 23 to set a 32-bit block count value to the argument of cmd23. this register would hold the upper 16bits of the cmd23 argument.

spirit:field.spirit:name: HOST_DMA_BDRY
spirit:field.spirit:description: host dma buffer boundary this field specifies the host memory buffer boundary. if this boundary is crossed, an interrupt (dma_int) is generated. this interrupt is reflected in <tx ready> field in the normal interrupt status register. 0x0 = 4 kb 0x1 = 8 kb 0x2 = 16 kb 0x3 = 32 kb 0x4 = 64 kb 0x5 = 128 kb 0x6 = 256 kb 0x7 = 512 kb

spirit:field.spirit:name: SD1S_BLOCK_SIZE36
spirit:field.spirit:description: block size

spirit:field.spirit:name: BLOCK_COUNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: block count the host controller decrements the block count after each block transfer. 0x1 = 1 block ... 0xffff = 65535 blocks the current value of block count is reflected in the current block count register.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ARG_L
spirit:field.spirit:description: argument low 16 lsb of command argument this value is inserted into 48 bits command token bits[23:8].

spirit:field.spirit:name: ARG_H
spirit:field.spirit:description: argument high 16 msb of command argument this value is inserted into 48 bits command token bits[39:24].

spirit:field.spirit:name: MULTI_BLK_SEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: multiple block select this bit should be set to 1 only when multiple blocks are to be transferred.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TO_HOST_DIR
spirit:field.spirit:description: data transfer direction select this bit defines the direction of the mmc1_dat[3:0] line data transfer. this bit is set to 1 by the host driver to transfer data from the sd card to the sd host controller, and it is set to 0 for all other commands.

spirit:field.spirit:name: AUTO_CMD_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: auto cmd enable this field determines use of auto command functions. 0x0 = auto command disabled 0x1 = auto cmd12 enable 0x2 = auto cmd23 enable 0x3 = reserved

spirit:field.spirit:name: BLK_CNT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: block count enable this bit validates the value in the block count register.

spirit:field.spirit:name: SD1S_DMA_EN69
spirit:field.spirit:description: dma enable if programmed input/output (pio) mode is required, this bit should be reset to 0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CMD_INDEX
spirit:field.spirit:description: command index these bits will be inserted into command token bits[45:40]

spirit:field.spirit:name: SD1S_CMD_TYPE78
spirit:field.spirit:description: command type 0x0 = normal command 0x1 = suspend command 0x2 = resume command 0x3 = abort command

spirit:field.spirit:name: DATA_PRESENT
spirit:field.spirit:description: data present 1 = indicates that data is present and will be transferred using the mmc1_dat[3:0] line. 0 = commands using only mmc1_cmd lines or commands with no data transfer but using busy signal on mmc1_dat[0] line (for example, cmd 38)

spirit:field.spirit:name: CMD_INDEX_CHK_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: command index check enable 1 = host controller checks the index field in the response to see if it has the same value as the command index. if it is not, it is reported as a command index error.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CMD_CRC_CHK_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: command crc check enable 1 = host controller checks the crc field in the response. if an error is detected, it is reported as a command crc error. the number of bits checked by the crc field value changes according to the length of response.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RESP_TYPE
spirit:field.spirit:description: response type select for sd/sd in spi modes for sd mode: 0x0 = no response 0x1 = response length is 136 bits 0x2 = response length is 48 bits 0x3 = response length is 48 bits and check busy after response crc field for r3 and r4 is expected to be all 1 bits. crc check should be disabled for these response types. for sd in spi mode: 0x0 = response length is 8 bits 0x1 = response length is 16 bits 0x2 = response length is 40 bits 0x3 = reserved

spirit:field.spirit:name: RESP0
spirit:field.spirit:description: response 0 this register contains bits[23:8] of the response token.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RESP1
spirit:field.spirit:description: response 1 this register contains bits[39:24] of the response token.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RESP2
spirit:field.spirit:description: response 2 for 48-bits response token, this register is don't care. for 136-bits response token, this register contains bits[55:40] of the response token.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RESP3
spirit:field.spirit:description: response 3 for 48-bits response token, this register is don't care. for 136-bits response token, this register contains bits[71:56] of the response token.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RESP4
spirit:field.spirit:description: response 4 for 48-bits response token, this register is don't care. for 136-bits response token, this register contains bits[87:72] of response token.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RESP5
spirit:field.spirit:description: response 5 for 48 bits response token, this register is don't care. for 136 bits response token, this register contains bits[103:88] of response token.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RESP6
spirit:field.spirit:description: response 6 for 48-bits response token, this register is don't care. for 136-bits response token, this register contains bits[119:104] of the response token. for auto cmd12 response, this register contains bits[23:8] of the response token.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RESP7
spirit:field.spirit:description: response 7 for 48-bits response token, this register is don't care. for 136-bits response token, this register contains bits[127:120] of the response token. for auto cmd12 response, this register contains bits[39:24] of the response token.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CPU_DATA0
spirit:field.spirit:description: processor data 0 16 lsb of the buffer

spirit:field.spirit:name: CPU_DATA1
spirit:field.spirit:description: processor data 1 16 msb of the buffer

spirit:field.spirit:name: BUFFER_RD_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: buffer read enable this field changes from 0x0 to 0x1 when block data is ready in the buffer and from 0x1 to 0x0 when all the block data is read from the buffer.

spirit:field.spirit:name: BUFFER_WR_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: buffer write enable this field changes from 0x0 to 0x1 when block data can be written to the buffer. so if this bit is set to 0x1, the entire block can be written to the buffer. this field changes from 0x1 to 0x0 when all the block data is written to the buffer.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_ACTIVE
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx active this field indicates read transfer is active. 1 = set:

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_ACTIVE
spirit:field.spirit:description: tx active indicates write transfer is active. 0 = no valid write data exists in the host controller 1 = set:

spirit:field.spirit:name: RETUNING_REQ
spirit:field.spirit:description: re-tuning request this field provides the status of the sampling clock. 0x0 = fixed or well tuned sampling clock 1 = sampling clock needs re-tuning

spirit:field.spirit:name: _DAT_ACTIVE
spirit:field.spirit:description: data line active this field provides the status of the data line. 0 = data line is free 1 = data line is in use

spirit:field.spirit:name: CMD_INHIBIT_DAT
spirit:field.spirit:description: command inhibit data this field provides the host driver status for issuing data commands. 0 = data command can be issued 1 = data command cannot be issued

spirit:field.spirit:name: CMD_INHIBIT_CMD
spirit:field.spirit:description: command inhibit command if this bit is 0, it indicates the mmc1_cmd line is not in use, and the host controller can issue a command using mmc1_cmd line. this bit is set after the command register is written. this bit is cleared when the command response is received. even if the <command inhibit data> field is set to 1, commands using only the mmc1_cmd line can be issued if this bit is 0. changing from 1 to 0 generates a command complete interrupt in the normal interrupt status register. if the host controller cannot issue the command because of a command conflict error, this bit remains 1, and the command complete is not set.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CMD_LEVEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: mmc1_cmd line signal level this status is used to check the mmc1_cmd line level to recover from errors and for debugging.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DAT_LEVEL190
spirit:field.spirit:description: mmc1_dat[3:0] line signal level this status is used to check the mmc1_dat[3:0] line level to recover from errors and for debugging. this is especially useful in detecting the busy signal level from mmc1_dat[0].

spirit:field.spirit:name: WRITE_PROT
spirit:field.spirit:description: write protect this field reflects the position of the write_protect latch on the sd card. this field should be ignored if there is no such feature being provided by the card in use.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CARD_DET
spirit:field.spirit:description: card detect this field reflects the value of the mmc1_cd pin. this field is only used for testing. 0 = card not detected 1 = card detected

spirit:field.spirit:name: CARD_STABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: card stable this field is only used for testing. it indicates the debounced value of the card present condition. 0 = card unstable 1 = card stable

spirit:field.spirit:name: CARD_INSERTED
spirit:field.spirit:description: card inserted this field indicates the presence of an sd card. 0 = card not inserted 1 = card inserted

spirit:field.spirit:name: SD_BUS_VLT
spirit:field.spirit:description: sd bus voltage this field reflects the voltage at operating conditions. 0x7 = 3.3v 0x6 = 3.0v 0x5 = 1.8v 0x0 to 0x4 = reserved

spirit:field.spirit:name: SD_BUS_POWER
spirit:field.spirit:description: sd bus power this field controls the power going out to the sd card. it will be cleared if one of the following occurs: the sd_bus_vlt and the voltage support in the capabilities register 1 do not match or if a card removal state was detected.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CARD_DET_S
spirit:field.spirit:description: card detect signal selection this field selects the source for card detection. 0 = card detect input pin 1 = card detect test level (for debugging purposes only) when the source for card detection is switched, the interrupt should be disabled during the switching period by clearing the normal interrupt status enable register in order to mask unexpected interrupts being caused by the glitch. this signal should be disabled via the normal interrupt status enable register during debounce period.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CARD_DET_L
spirit:field.spirit:description: card detect test level 1 = card inserted 0 = no card inserted

spirit:field.spirit:name: EX_DATA_WIDTH
spirit:field.spirit:description: this bit controls the 8-bit mode. 0x0 = data width for bus mode is determined by <data_width>. 0x1 = 8-bit data width.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DMA_SEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: dma select one of supported dma modes as selected. the host driver checks support of dma modes using the capabilities register 1. use of the selected dma is determined by the <dma enable> field in the transfer mode register. 0x0 = sdma 0x1 = adma 1 0x2 = 32-bit address adma2 0x3 = reserved

spirit:field.spirit:name: HI_SPEED_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: extend data output enable 0 = normal 1 = mmc1_cmd and mmc1_dat[3:0] are driven from rising edge of clock

spirit:field.spirit:name: DATA_WIDTH
spirit:field.spirit:description: data width 1 = 4-bit data mode 0 = 1-bit data mode, using only mmc1_dat[0] refer to the ce-ata register 2 for 8-bit mode support.

spirit:field.spirit:name: LED_CTRL
spirit:field.spirit:description: led control 1 = led on 0 = led off

spirit:field.spirit:name: W_REMOVAL
spirit:field.spirit:description: wakeup on card removal 1 = enable wakeup event on card removal detection 0 = no wakeup event

spirit:field.spirit:name: W_INSERTION
spirit:field.spirit:description: wakeup on card insertion 1 = enable wakeup event on card insertion detection 0 = no wakeup event

spirit:field.spirit:name: W_CARD_INT
spirit:field.spirit:description: wakeup on card interrupt 1 = enable wakeup event on card interrupt detection 0 = no wakeup event

spirit:field.spirit:name: INT_BLK_GAP
spirit:field.spirit:description: block gap interrupt this field is only valid for 4-bit mode. 1 = enables interrupt detection at block gap for multiple block transfers

spirit:field.spirit:name: RD_WAIT_CTL
spirit:field.spirit:description: read wait control if the card supports read wait, set this bit to enable use of the read wait protocol to stop read data using the mmc1_dat[2] line by host hardware. otherwise, host controller has to stop sd clock to hold read data. when the host driver detects a card insertion, it will set this bit according to the cccr of the sdio card.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CONT_REQ
spirit:field.spirit:description: continue request this field is used to restart a transaction which was stopped using the <stop at block gap request>. to cancel stop at the block gap, set the <stop at block gap request> field to 0 and set this field to 1 to restart the transfer. host controller automatically clears this field in either of the following cases:

spirit:field.spirit:name: STOP_AT_BLOCK_GAP_REQ
spirit:field.spirit:description: stop at block gap request this field is used to stop executing a transaction at the next block gap for both dma and non-dma transfers. until the transfer complete is set to 1, indicating a transfer completion, the host driver will leave this bit set to 1. clearing both this field and the <continue request> field will not cause the transaction to restart. read wait is used to stop the read transaction at the block gap. the host controller will stop the clock at block gap request for write transfer, but for read transfer, it will stop the clock if <read wait control> is 0. otherwise, the host controller issues a read wait command to stop read data.

spirit:field.spirit:name: SD_FREQ_SEL_LO
spirit:field.spirit:description: sdclk frequency select lower bits this along with <sd_freq_sel_hi> define the clock divider value to be used by the host controller. so the final sd_freq_sel = {sd_freq_sel_hi[1:0],sd_freq_sel_lo[7:0]}. the selected value is multiplied by 2 to get the actual divide value. for. e.g sd_freq_sel = 0x00 = base clock sd_freq_sel = 0x01 = divide by 2 of base clock sd_freq_sel = 0x02 = divide by 4 of base clock sd_freq_sel = 0x3 = divide by 6 of base clock. ... sd_freq_sel = 0x3ff = divide by 2046 of base clock.

spirit:field.spirit:name: SD_FREQ_SEL_HI
spirit:field.spirit:description: sdclk frequency select upper bits this along with <sd_freq_sel_lo> define the clock divider value to be used by the host controller. so the final sd_freq_sel = {sd_freq_sel_hi[1:0],sd_freq_sel_lo[7:0]}. the selected value is multiplied by 2 to get the actual divide value. for. e.g sd_freq_sel = 0x00 = base clock sd_freq_sel = 0x01 = divide by 2 of base clock sd_freq_sel = 0x02 = divide by 4 of base clock sd_freq_sel = 0x3 = divide by 6 of base clock. ... sd_freq_sel = 0x3ff = divide by 2046 of base clock.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CLK_GEN_SEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: clock generator select this field is used to select the clock generator mode. 0x1 = programmable clock mode 0x0 = divided clock mode

spirit:field.spirit:name: SD_CLK_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: sdclk clock enable this bit controls the sdclk to the card. before using the card, this bit should be set during the initialization phase.

spirit:field.spirit:name: INT_CLK_STABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: internal clock stable this field is set to 1 once the controller detects that the internal clock is stable after setting of the <internal clock enable> field.

spirit:field.spirit:name: INT_CLK_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: internal clock enable this field controls the sdclk to the internal logic. 1 = enable clock 0 = disable

spirit:field.spirit:name: SW_RST_DAT
spirit:field.spirit:description: soft reset for data port of logic

spirit:field.spirit:name: SW_RST_CMD
spirit:field.spirit:description: soft reset for command part of logic

spirit:field.spirit:name: SW_RST_ALL
spirit:field.spirit:description: software reset for all this reset affects the status, state machine, and fifos synchronously. this field also resets all private registers.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TIMEOUT_VALUE
spirit:field.spirit:description: timeout value determines the interval by which mmc1_dat[3:0] line timeouts are detected. this timeout is initiated in the following cases:

spirit:field.spirit:name: ERR_INT
spirit:field.spirit:description: error interrupt if any of bits in the error interrupt status register are set, then this bit is set.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CQ_INT
spirit:field.spirit:description: command queuing interrupt this interrupt is asserted when at least one of the bits in cqis register is set. this interrupt is cleared only clearing the source interrupt in cqis register

spirit:field.spirit:name: RETUNING_INT
spirit:field.spirit:description: re-tuning event interrupt this status is set if re-tuning request in the <present state register> changes from 0x0 to 0x1. host controller requests host driver to perform re-tuning fro next data transfer. current data transfer can be completed without re-tuning.

spirit:field.spirit:name: INT_C
spirit:field.spirit:description: this status is set if int_c is enabled and int_c# pin is in low level. writing this bit to 0x1 does not clear this bit. it is cleared by resetting the int_c interrupt factor. refer to shared bus control register.

spirit:field.spirit:name: INT_B
spirit:field.spirit:description: this status is set if int_b is enabled and int_b# pin is in low level. writing this bit to 0x1 does not clear this bit. it is cleared by resetting the int_b interrupt factor. refer to shared bus control register.

spirit:field.spirit:name: INT_A
spirit:field.spirit:description: this status is set if int_a is enabled and int_a# pin is in low level. writing this bit to 0x1 does not clear this bit. it is cleared by resetting the int_a interrupt factor. refer to shared bus control register.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CARD_INT
spirit:field.spirit:description: card interrupt 1 = host controller detects an interrupt from the card

spirit:field.spirit:name: CARD_REM_INT
spirit:field.spirit:description: card removal interrupt 1 = card removal event detected

spirit:field.spirit:name: CARD_INS_INT
spirit:field.spirit:description: card insertion interrupt 1 = card insertion event detected

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_RDY
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx ready this status is set if the <buffer read enable> field in the present state register 1 changes from 0x0 to 0x1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_RDY
spirit:field.spirit:description: tx ready this status is set if the <buffer write enable> field in the present state register 1 changes from 0x0 to 0x1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DMA_INT
spirit:field.spirit:description: dma interrupt this status is set if the host controller detects dma crossing over the <host dma buffer boundary> field in the block size register.

spirit:field.spirit:name: BLOCK_GAP_EVT
spirit:field.spirit:description: block gap event if the <stop at block gap request> field in the block gap control register is set, this field is set when both a read/write transaction is stopped at a block gap. if the <stop at block gap request> field is not set to 1, this bit is not set to 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: XFER_COMPLETE
spirit:field.spirit:description: transfer complete this bit is set when a read/write transaction is completed for read transaction, this bit is set at the falling edge of read transfer active status. there are two cases in which this occurs:

spirit:field.spirit:name: CMD_COMPLETE
spirit:field.spirit:description: command complete this bit is set when the end bit of the command response (except auto cmd12) is received. note that command timeout error has higher priority than command complete.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CRC_STATUS_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: crc status error 1 = crc status start bit or crc status end bit or boot ack status, returned from the card in write transaction has errors

spirit:field.spirit:name: CPL_TIMEOUT_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: command completion signal timeout error this field is applicable for ce-ata mode only. 1 = a command completion signal timeout occurred

spirit:field.spirit:name: AXI_RESP_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: axi bus response error 1 = a response other than <q>okay</q> was received on the axi bus.

spirit:field.spirit:name: SPI_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: spi mode error 1 = error occurred in spi mode for which cause can be determined by reading the <spi error token> field in the spi mode register 0 = no error has occurred

spirit:field.spirit:name: ADMA_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: adma (advanced direct memory access) error this bit is set when the host controller detects any errors during an adma-based data transfer. the adma state at the time an error occurs is saved in the adma error status register. the host controller also generates this interrupt when it detects any invalid descriptor data. the <adma error state> field in the adma error status register indicates the state in which an error occurred. the host driver may find that a valid bit is not set at the error descriptor. 1 = error 0 = no error

spirit:field.spirit:name: AUTO_CMD12_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: auto cmd12 error occurs when detecting that one of the bits in auto cmd12 error status register has changed from 0 to 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CUR_LIMIT_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: current limit error this feature is not supported and this bit will always be read as 0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RD_DATA_END_BIT_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: readdata end bit error 1 = 0 detected at the end bit position of read data which uses the mmc1_dat[3:0] line or at the end bit position of the crc status

spirit:field.spirit:name: RD_DATA_CRC_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: read data crc error 1 = read data which uses the mmc1_dat[3:0] line transferred or write crc status having a value other than 010 detected

spirit:field.spirit:name: DATA_TIMEOUT_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: data timeout error 1 = set when one of the following is detected:

spirit:field.spirit:name: CMD_INDEX_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: command index error 0 = no command index error has occurred in the command response 1 = command index error has occurred in the command response

spirit:field.spirit:name: CMD_END_BIT_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: command end bit error 0 = detection of end bit of a command response in 1 1 = detection of end bit of a command response is 0

spirit:field.spirit:name: CMD_CRC_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: command crc error 1 = set in two cases:

spirit:field.spirit:name: CMD_TIMEOUT_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: command timeout error 1 = no response is returned within 64 sdclk cycles from the end bit of the command

spirit:field.spirit:name: CQ_STATUS_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: command queuing status enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: RETUNE_INT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: re_tuning interrupt enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: INT_C_INT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: int_c enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: INT_B_INT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: int_b enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: INT_A_INT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: int_a enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: CARD_INT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: card interrupt enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: CARD_REM_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: card removal status enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: CARD_INS_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: card insertion status enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: RD_RDY_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: buffer read ready enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_RDY_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: buffer write ready enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: DMA_INT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: dma interrupt enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: BLOCK_GAP_EVT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: block gap event enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: XFER_COMPLETE_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: transfer complete enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: CMD_COMPLETE_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: command complete enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: CRC_STATUS_ERR_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: crc status error enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: CPL_TIMEOUT_ERR_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: cpl timeout error enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: AXI_RESP_ERR_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: axi response error enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: SPI_ERR_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: spi error enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: TUNING_ERR_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: tuning error enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: ADMA_ERR_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: adma error enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: AUTO_CMD12_ERR_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: auto cmd12 error enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: CUR_LIM_ERR_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: current limit error enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: RD_DATA_END_BIT_ERR_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: data end bit error enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: RD_DATA_CRC_ERR_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: data crc error enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: DATA_TIMEOUT_ERR_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: data timeout error enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: CMD_INDEX_ERR_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: command index error enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: CMD_END_BIT_ERR_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: command end bit error enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: CMD_CRC_ERR_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: command crc error enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: CMD_TIMEOUT_ERR_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: command timeout error enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:register.spirit:name: SD_NORMAL_INT_STATUS_INT_EN
spirit:register.spirit:description: Normal Interrupt Status Interrupt Enable Register

spirit:field.spirit:name: CQ_SIGNAL_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: command queuing signal enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: RETUNE_INT_INT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: re-tuning interrupt interrupt enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: INT_C_INT_INT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: int_c interrupt interrupt enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: INT_B_INT_INT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: int_b interrupt interrupt enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: INT_A_INT_INT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: int_a interrupt interrupt enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: CARD_INT_INT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: card interrupt interrupt enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: CARD_REM_INT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: card removal interrupt enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: CARD_INS_INT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: card insertion interrupt enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_RDY_INT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: buffer read ready interrupt enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_RDY_INT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: buffer write ready interrupt enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: DMA_INT_INT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: dma interrupt interrupt enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: BLOCK_GAP_EVT_INT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: block gap event interrupt enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: XFER_COMPLETE_INT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: transfer complete interrupt enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: CMD_COMPLETE_INT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: command complete interrupt enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:register.spirit:name: SD_ERROR_INT_STATUS_INT_EN
spirit:register.spirit:description: Error Interrupt Status Interrupt Enable Register

spirit:field.spirit:name: CRC_STATUS_ERR_INT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: crc status error interrupt enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: CPL_TIMEOUT_ERR_INT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: cpl timeout error interrupt enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: AXI_RESP_ERR_INT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: axi response error interrupt enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: SPI_ERR_INT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: spi error interrupt enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: TUNE_ERR_INT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: tuning error interrupt enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: ADMA_ERR_INT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: adma error interrupt enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: AUTO_CMD12_ERR_INT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: auto cmd12 error interrupt enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: CUR_LIM_ERR_INT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: current limit error interrupt enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: RD_DATA_END_BIT_ERR_INT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: data end bit error interrupt enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: RD_DATA_CRC_ERR_INT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: data crc error interrupt enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: DATA_TIMEOUT_ERR_INT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: data timeout error interrupt enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: CMD_INDEX_ERR_INT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: command index error interrupt enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: CMD_END_BIT_ERR_INT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: command end bit interrupt error enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: CMD_CRC_ERR_INT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: command crc error interrupt enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: CMD_TIMEOUT_ERR_INT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: command timeout error interrupt enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: CMD_NOT_ISSUED
spirit:field.spirit:description: command not issued due to auto_cmd12 error

spirit:field.spirit:name: AUTO_CMD_INDEX_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: auto cmd12 or auto cmd23 error this error occurs if the command index error occurs in response to a command 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: AUTO_CMD_END_BIT_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: auto cmd12 or auto cmd23end bit error this error occurs when detecting that the end bit of command response is 0. 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: AUTO_CMD_CRC_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: auto cmd12 or auto cmd23 crc error this error occurs when detecting crc error in the command response. 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: AUTO_CMD_TIMEOUT_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: auto cmd12 or auto cmd23 timeout error this error occurs if no response is returned within 64 sdclk cycles from the end bit of command. 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: AUTO_CMD12_NOT_EXE
spirit:field.spirit:description: auto cmd12 not executed this error occurs when host controller cannot issue auto cmd12 to stop multiple block data transfer due to some errors. 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: PRE_VAL_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: preset value enable 0x1 = automatic selection by preset value are enabled 0x0 = sdclk and driver strength are controlled by host driver

spirit:field.spirit:name: ASYNC_INT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: asynchronous interrupt enable this bit can be set to 0x1 if a card supports asynchronous interrupts and <async_int_support> is set to 0x1 in the capabilities register. asynchronous interrupt is effective when dat[1] interrupt is used in 4-bit sd mode (and zero is set to <int_pin_sel> in shared bus control register). if this bit is set to 0x1, the host driver can stop the sdclk during asynchronous interrupt period to save power. during this period, the host controller continues to deliver the card interrupt to the host when it is asserted by the card. 0x1 = enabled 0x0 = disabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: SAMPLING_CLK_SEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: sampling clock select host controller uses this bit to select sampling clock to receive cmd and dat. this bit is set by tuning procedure and valid after the completion of tuning (when <exe_tuning> is cleared). setting 0x1 means that tuning is completed successfully and setting 0x0 means that tuning is failed. writing 0x1 to this bit is meaningless and ignored. a tuning circuit is reset by writing 0x0. this bit can be cleared by setting <exe_tuning>. once the tuning circuit is reset, it will take time to complete tuning sequence. therefore, host driver should keep this bit to 0x1 to perform re-tuning sequence in a short time. change of this bit is not allowed while the host controller is receiving response or a read data block. 0x1 = tuned clock is used to sample data 0x0 = fixed clock is used to sample data.

spirit:field.spirit:name: EXE_TUNING
spirit:field.spirit:description: execute tuning. this bit is set to 0x1 to start tuning procedure and automatically cleared when tuning procedure is completed. the result of the tuning is indicated to <sampling_clk_sel>. tuning procedure is aborted by writing 0x0. 0x1 = execute tuning. 0x0 = not tuned or tuning completed.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DRV_STRENGTH_SEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: driver strength select. host controller output driver in 1.8v signaling is selected by this field. in 3.3v signaling this field is not effective. this field can be set depending on driver type a, c and d support bits in the capabilities register. this bit depends on setting of <pre_val_en>. if <pre_val_en> = 0x0, this field is set by the host driver. if <pre_val_en> = 0x1, this field is automatically set by a value specified in one of the preset value registers. 0x0 = driver type b 0x1 = driver type a 0x2 = driver type c 0x3 = driver type d

spirit:field.spirit:name: SDH_V18_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: 1.8v signaling enable 0x1 = 1.8v signaling enable 0x0 = 3.3v signaling enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: UHS_MODE_SEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: uhs mode select. this field is used to select one of uhs-i modes and effective when <sdh_v18_en> = 0x1. if <pre_val_en> in the host control2 register is set to 0x1, host controller set sdclk frequency select, clock generator select in the clock control register and driver strength select according to the preset value registers. in this case, one of the preset value registers is selected by this field. host driver should reset <sd_clk_en> before changing this field to avoid generating clock glitch 0x0 = sdr12 0x1 = sdr25 0x2 = sdr50 0x3 = sdr104 0x4 = ddr50 all other values are reserved for mmc mode, added two backdoor defined modes: 5(101) hs200 mode 5(110) hs400 mode normally sw only need set rx114 hs200/hs400 modes

spirit:field.spirit:name: BASE_FREQ
spirit:field.spirit:description: base frequency the base clock frequency for sdclk 0xc8 = 200 mhz (actually 198.24 mhz). 0x0 means get info via other method.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TIMEOUT_UNIT
spirit:field.spirit:description: timeout unit the unit of base clock used to detect timeouts. 1 = mhz 0 = khz

spirit:field.spirit:name: TIMEOUT_FREQ
spirit:field.spirit:description: timeout frequency this value indicates the base clock frequency used to detect timeouts. 0x32 = 50 mhz (actually 49.56 mhz). 0x0 means get info via other method.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFG_SLOT_TYPE
spirit:field.spirit:description: slot type this field indicates what type of slot the host controller is connected to. 0x0 = removable card slot 0x1 = embedded slot for one device 0x2 = shared bus slot 0x3 = reserved

spirit:field.spirit:name: ASYNC_INT_SUPPORT
spirit:field.spirit:description: asynchronous interrupt support. 0x1 = asynchronous interrupt supported 0x0 = asynchronous interrupt not supported

spirit:field.spirit:name: SYS_BUS_64_SUPPORT
spirit:field.spirit:description: 64-bit system bus support this bit indicates whether the host controller is capable of 64-bit system bus. 0x1 = 64-bit system bus supported, 0x0 = 64-bit system bus not supported.

spirit:field.spirit:name: VLG_18_SUPPORT
spirit:field.spirit:description: voltage support 1.8v this bit indicates whether the host controller is capable of 1.8v. 0x1 = 1.8v supported, 0x0 = 1.8v not supported.

spirit:field.spirit:name: VLG_30_SUPPORT
spirit:field.spirit:description: voltage support 3.0v this bit indicates whether the host controller is capable of 3.0v. 0x1 = 3.0v supported, 0x0 = 3.0v not supported.

spirit:field.spirit:name: VLG_33_SUPPORT
spirit:field.spirit:description: voltage support 3.3v this bit indicates whether the host controller is capable of 3.3v. 0x1 = 3.3v supported, 0x0 = 3.3v not supported.

spirit:field.spirit:name: SUS_RES_SUPPORT
spirit:field.spirit:description: suspend resume support this bit indicates whether the host controller is capable of suspend resume commands. 0x1 = suspend/resume supported, 0x0 = suspend/resume not supported.

spirit:field.spirit:name: SDMA_SUPPORT
spirit:field.spirit:description: sdma support this bit indicates whether the host controller is capable of sdma. 0x1 = sdma supported, 0x0 = sdma not supported.

spirit:field.spirit:name: HI_SPEED_SUPPORT
spirit:field.spirit:description: high speed support this bit indicates whether the host controller is capable of high speed mode (25 - 50mhz). 0x1 = high speed mode supported, 0x0 = high speed mode not supported.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ADMA1_SUPPORT
spirit:field.spirit:description: adma1 support this bit indicates whether the host controller is capable of adma1. 0x1 = adma1 supported, 0x0 = adma1 not supported.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ADMA2_SUPPORT
spirit:field.spirit:description: adma2 support this bit indicates whether the host controller is capable of adma2. 0x1 = adma2 supported, 0x0 = adma2 not supported.

spirit:field.spirit:name: EX_DATA_WIDTH_SUPPORT
spirit:field.spirit:description: 8-bit support this bit indicates whether the host controller is capable of 8-bit bus operation. 0x1 = 8-bit supported 0x0 = 8-bit not supported

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAX_BLK_LEN
spirit:field.spirit:description: maximum block length the maximum block length in bytes. 0x0 = 512 bytes

spirit:field.spirit:name: RETUNE_MODES
spirit:field.spirit:description: re_tuning modes. this field selects the re-tuning method and limits the maximum data length. 0x0 = mode1 = timer 0x1 = mode2 = timer and re-tuning request 0x2 = mode3 = auto re-tuning (for transfer) timer and re-tuning request 0x3 = reserved.

spirit:field.spirit:name: SDR50_TUNE
spirit:field.spirit:description: use tuning for sdr50 mode. 0x1 = sdr50 requires tuning 0x0 = sdr50 does not require tuning

spirit:field.spirit:name: TMR_RETUNE
spirit:field.spirit:description: timer count for re-tuning. this field indicates an initial value of the re-tuning timer for mode 1 to 3. 0xf = get information from other source.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DRV_TYPE_D
spirit:field.spirit:description: driver type d support 0x1 = driver type d is supported 0x0 = driver type d is not supported

spirit:field.spirit:name: DRV_TYPE_C
spirit:field.spirit:description: driver type c support. 0x1 = driver type c is supported. 0x0 = driver type c is not supported.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DRV_TYPE_A
spirit:field.spirit:description: driver type a support 0x1 = driver type a is supported 0x0 = driver type a is not supported.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DDR50_SUPPORT
spirit:field.spirit:description: ddr50 support 0x1 =ddr50 is supported 0x0 =ddr50 is not supported.

spirit:field.spirit:name: SDR104_SUPPORT
spirit:field.spirit:description: sdr104 support 0x1 = sdr104 is supported 0x0 = sdr104 is not supported.

spirit:field.spirit:name: SDR50_SUPPORT
spirit:field.spirit:description: sdr50 support 0x1 = sdr50 is supported 0x0 = sdr50 is not supported.

spirit:field.spirit:name: <CLK_MULTIPLIER>
spirit:field.spirit:description: clock multiplier this field indicates clock multiplier value of programmable clock generator. 0x0 means that host controller does not support programmable clock generator.

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAX_CUR_30
spirit:field.spirit:description: maximum current for 3.0v 0x0 = get information via another method 0x1 = 4 ma 0x2 = 8 ma ... 0xf = 1020 ma

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAX_CUR_33
spirit:field.spirit:description: maximum current for 3.3v 0x0 = get information via another method 0x1 = 4 ma 0x2 = 8 ma ... 0xf = 1020 ma

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAX_CUR_18
spirit:field.spirit:description: maximum current for 1.8v 0x0 = get information via another method 0x1 = 4 ma 0x2 = 8 ma ... 0xff = 1020 ma

spirit:register.spirit:name: SD_FORCE_EVENT_AUTO_CMD12_ERROR
spirit:register.spirit:description: Force Event Auto cmd12 Error Register

spirit:field.spirit:name: F_ACMD12_ISSUE_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: force event for command not issued by auto cmd12 error when 1 is written at this location, it sets the <command not issued due to auto_cmd12 error> field in the auto cmd12 error status register.

spirit:field.spirit:name: F_ACMD_INDEX_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: force event for auto cmd index error when 1 is written at this location, it sets the <auto cmd error> field in the auto cmd error status register.

spirit:field.spirit:name: F__ACMD_EBIT_ERR

spirit:field.spirit:name: F_ACMD_CRC_ERR

spirit:field.spirit:name: F_ACMD_TO_ERR

spirit:field.spirit:name: F_ACMD12_NEXE_ERR

spirit:register.spirit:name: SD_FORCE_EVENT_FOR_ERROR_STATUS

spirit:field.spirit:name: F_CRC_STATUS_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: force event for crc status error when 1 is written at this location, it sets the <crc status error> field in the error interrupt status register.

spirit:field.spirit:name: F_CPL_TIMEOUT_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: force event for cpl timeout error when 1 is written at this location, it sets the <command completion signal timeout error> field in the error interrupt status register.

spirit:field.spirit:name: F_AXI_RESP_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: force event for axi response bit error when 1 is written at this location, it sets the <axi bus response error> field in the error interrupt status register.

spirit:field.spirit:name: F_SPI_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: force event for spi error when 1 is written at this location, it sets the <spi mode error> field in the error interrupt status register.

spirit:field.spirit:name: F_ADMA_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: force event for adma error when 1 is written at this location, it sets the <adma error> field in the error interrupt status register.

spirit:field.spirit:name: F_ACMD12_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: force event for auto cmd12 error when 1 is written at this location, it sets the <auto cmd12 error> field in the error interrupt status register.

spirit:field.spirit:name: F_CURRENT_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: force event for current limit error when 1 is written at this location, it sets the <current limit error> field in the error interrupt status register.

spirit:field.spirit:name: F_DAT_END_BIT_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: force event for data end bit error when 1 is written at this location, it sets the <readdataend bit error> field in the error interrupt status register.

spirit:field.spirit:name: F_DAT_CRC_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: force event for data crc error when 1 is written at this location, it sets the <read data crc error> field in the error interrupt status register.

spirit:field.spirit:name: F_DAT_TO_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: force event for data timeout error when 1 is written at this location, it sets the <read data crc error> field in the error interrupt status register.

spirit:field.spirit:name: F_CMD_INDEX_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: force event for command index error when 1 is written at this location, it sets the <data timeout error> field in the error interrupt status register.

spirit:field.spirit:name: F_CMD_END_BIT_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: force event for command end bit error when 1 is written at this location, it sets the <command index error> field in the error interrupt status register.

spirit:field.spirit:name: F_CMD_CRC_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: force event for command crc error when 1 is written at this location, it sets the <command crc error> field in the error interrupt status register.

spirit:field.spirit:name: F_CMD_TO_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: force event for command timeout error when 1 is written at this location, it sets the <command timeout error> field in the error interrupt status register.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ADMA_LEN_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: adma length mismatch error this error occurs in the following two cases:

spirit:field.spirit:name: ADMA_STATE
spirit:field.spirit:description: adma error state this field indicates the state of adma when error occurred during adma transfer. this field never indicates 0x2 because adma never stops in this state.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ADMA_SYS_ADDR568
spirit:field.spirit:description: adma system address this register holds byte address of executing command of the descriptor table. at the start of adma, this register should be programmed to point to the start address of the descriptor table. this register is incremented whenever fetching a descriptor line. when an adma error interrupt is generated, this register will hold a valid descriptor address depending on the adma state.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ADMA_SYS_ADDR575
spirit:field.spirit:description: adma system address this register holds byte address of executing command of the descriptor table. at the start of adma, this register should be programmed to point to the start address of the descriptor table. this register is incremented whenever fetching a descriptor line. when an adma error interrupt is generated, this register will hold a valid descriptor address depending on the adma state.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ADMA_SYS_ADDR581
spirit:field.spirit:description: adma system address this register holds byte address of executing command of the descriptor table. at the start of adma, this register should be programmed to point to the start address of the descriptor table. this register is incremented whenever fetching a descriptor line. when an adma error interrupt is generated, this register will hold a valid descriptor address depending on the adam state.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ADMA_SYS_ADDR588
spirit:field.spirit:description: adma system address this register holds byte address of executing command of the descriptor table. at the start of adma, this register should be programmed to point to the start address of the descriptor table. this register is incremented whenever fetching a descriptor line. when an adma error interrupt is generated, this register will hold a valid descriptor address depending on the adma state.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DRV_STRENGTH_VAL595
spirit:field.spirit:description: driver strength select value driver strength is supported by 1.8v signaling bus speed modes. this field is meaningless for 3.3v signaling. 0x0 = driver type b 0x1 = driver type a 0x2 = driver type c 0x3 = driver type d

spirit:field.spirit:name: CLKGEN_SEL_VAL597
spirit:field.spirit:description: clock generator select value. this bit is effective when host controller supports programmable clock generator. 0x1 = programmable clock generator 0x0 = divided clock

spirit:field.spirit:name: SDCLK_FREQ_SEL_VAL598
spirit:field.spirit:description: sdclk frequency select value 10-bit preset value to set <sdclk_freq_sel> in the clock control register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: PRESET_VALUE_FOR_DS
spirit:register.spirit:description: Preset Value Register for Default Speed

spirit:field.spirit:name: DRV_STRENGTH_VAL605
spirit:field.spirit:description: driver strength select value driver strength is supported by 1.8v signaling bus speed modes. this field is meaningless for 3.3v signaling. 0x0 = driver type b 0x1 = driver type a 0x2 = driver type c 0x3 = driver type d

spirit:field.spirit:name: CLKGEN_SEL_VAL607
spirit:field.spirit:description: clock generator select value. this bit is effective when host controller supports programmable clock generator. 0x1 = programmable clock generator 0x0 = divided clock

spirit:field.spirit:name: SDCLK_FREQ_SEL_VAL608
spirit:field.spirit:description: sdclk frequency select value. 10-bit preset value to set <sdclk_freq_sel> in the clock control register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: PRESET_VALUE_FOR_HS
spirit:register.spirit:description: Preset Value Register for High Speed

spirit:field.spirit:name: DRV_STRENGTH_VAL615
spirit:field.spirit:description: driver strength select value driver strength is supported by 1.8v signaling bus speed modes. this field is meaningless for 3.3v signaling. 0x0 = driver type b 0x1 = driver type a 0x2 = driver type c 0x3 = driver type d

spirit:field.spirit:name: CLKGEN_SEL_VAL617
spirit:field.spirit:description: clock generator select value this bit is effective when host controller supports programmable clock generator. 0x1 = programmable clock generator 0x0 = divided clock

spirit:field.spirit:name: SDCLK_FREQ_SEL_VAL618
spirit:field.spirit:description: sdclk frequency select value. 10-bit preset value to set <sdclk_freq_sel> in the clock control register.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DRV_STRENGTH_VAL625
spirit:field.spirit:description: driver strength select value driver strength is supported by 1.8v signaling bus speed modes. this field is meaningless for 3.3v signaling. 0x0 = driver type b 0x1 = driver type a 0x2 = driver type c 0x3 = driver type d

spirit:field.spirit:name: CLKGEN_SEL_VAL627
spirit:field.spirit:description: clock generator select value this bit is effective when host controller supports programmable clock generator. 0x1 = programmable clock generator 0x0 = divided clock

spirit:field.spirit:name: SDCLK_FREQ_SEL_VAL628
spirit:field.spirit:description: sdclk frequency select value 10-bit preset value to set <sdclk_freq_sel> in the clock control register.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CLKGEN_SEL_VAL637
spirit:field.spirit:description: clock generator select value this bit is effective when host controller supports programmable clock generator. 0x1 = programmable clock generator 0x0 = divided clock

spirit:field.spirit:name: SDCLK_FREQ_SEL_VAL638
spirit:field.spirit:description: sdclk frequency select value 10-bit preset value to set <sdclk_freq_sel> in the clock control register.
