spirit:field.spirit:name: CLKGEN_SEL_VAL647
spirit:field.spirit:description: clock generator select value this bit is effective when host controller supports programmable clock generator. 0x1 = programmable clock generator 0x0 = divided clock

spirit:field.spirit:name: SDCLK_FREQ_SEL_VAL648
spirit:field.spirit:description: sdclk frequency select value. 10-bit preset value to set <sdclk_freq_sel> in the clock control register.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DRV_STRENGTH_VAL655
spirit:field.spirit:description: driver strength select value driver strength is supported by 1.8v signaling bus speed modes. this field is meaningless for 3.3v signaling. 0x0 = driver type b 0x1 = driver type a 0x2 = driver type c 0x3 = driver type d

spirit:field.spirit:name: CLKGEN_SEL_VAL657
spirit:field.spirit:description: clock generator select value this bit is effective when host controller supports programmable clock generator. 0x1 = programmable clock generator 0x0 = divided clock

spirit:field.spirit:name: SDCLK_FREQ_SEL_VAL658
spirit:field.spirit:description: sdclk frequency select value 10-bit preset value to set <sdclk_freq_sel> in the clock control register.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DRV_STRENGTH_VAL665
spirit:field.spirit:description: driver strength select value driver strength is supported by 1.8v signaling bus speed modes. this field is meaningless for 3.3v signaling. 0x0 = driver type b 0x1 = driver type a 0x2 = driver type c 0x3 = driver type d

spirit:field.spirit:name: CLKGEN_SEL_VAL667
spirit:field.spirit:description: clock generator select value this bit is effective when host controller supports programmable clock generator. 0x1 = programmable clock generator 0x0 = divided clock

spirit:field.spirit:name: SDCLK_FREQ_SEL_VAL668
spirit:field.spirit:description: sdclk frequency select value. 10-bit preset value to set <sdclk_freq_sel> in the clock control register.

spirit:field.spirit:name: BEND_PWR_CTRL
spirit:field.spirit:description: back-end power control each bit of this field controls back-end power supply for an embedded device. host interface voltage is not controlled by this field. the number of devices supported is specified by <num_clk_pins> and a maximum of 7 devices can be controlled. each bit corresponds to each device. bit[24] corresponds to device 1 and bit[30] corresponds to device 7. the function of each bit is: 0x0 = back-end power is off 0x1 = back-end power is supplied

spirit:field.spirit:name: INT_PIN_SEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: interrupt pin select interrupt pin inputs are enabled by this field. enable of unsupported interrupt pin is meaningless. 0x0 = interrupt is detected by interrupt cycle.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CLK_PIN_SEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: clock pin select one of the clock pin outputs is selected by this field. 0x0 = clock pins are disabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: BUS_WIDTH_PRESET
spirit:field.spirit:description: bus width preset this field defines the bus width preset for devices on a shared bus. 0x0 = bus width defined by <data_transfer_width> 0x1 = 8-bit mode

spirit:field.spirit:name: NUM_INT_PINS
spirit:field.spirit:description: number of interrupt input pins this field defines the number of interrupt input pins supported on shared bus system. 0x0 = interrupt input pin is not supported

spirit:field.spirit:name: NUM_CLK_PINS
spirit:field.spirit:description: number of clock pins this field indicates support of clock pins to select one of the devices on shared bus. 0x0 = shared bus is not supported

spirit:field.spirit:name: SLOT_INT1
spirit:field.spirit:description: interrupt line for slot 1

spirit:field.spirit:name: SLOT_INT0
spirit:field.spirit:description: interrupt line for slot 0

spirit:field.spirit:name: SD_VER
spirit:field.spirit:description: sd host specification number 0x0 = supports version 1.0 0x1 = supports version 2.0 0x2 = supports version 3.0 all other values are reserved.

spirit:register.spirit:name: SDHC_VID_PID
spirit:register.spirit:description: SD HOST CTRL Vendor ID/Project ID/version ID Register

spirit:field.spirit:name: VERSION_ID
spirit:field.spirit:description: 0x1 means first ip version in project "aquila"

spirit:field.spirit:name: PROJECT_ID
spirit:field.spirit:description: 0x1 means first project "aquila" in vendor asr

spirit:field.spirit:name: VENDOR_ID
spirit:field.spirit:description: stands for vendor name "asr", contains three fields, every field use one or two hexadecimal to show the english character's number in alphabet bit[19:16]: a (a, 10th of the alphabet) bit[15:8]: 0x13 (s, 19th of the alphabet) bit[7:0]:0x12 (r, 18th of the alphabet)

spirit:register.spirit:name: SDHC_OP_CTRL
spirit:register.spirit:description: SDHC Opeartion Control register (Clock and Burst Size Setup Register)

spirit:field.spirit:name: WR_OSTDG
spirit:field.spirit:description: this field controls the outstanding write requests on axi. 0x0 = allow outstanding requests on axi. 0x1 = do not allow outstanding requests on axi.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RD_OSTDG
spirit:field.spirit:description: this field controls the outstanding read requests on axi. 0x0 = allow outstanding requests on axi. 0x1 = do not allow outstanding requests on axi.

spirit:field.spirit:name: WR_ENDIAN
spirit:field.spirit:description: write endian data being written to the card is in the following format. 1 = little endian 0 = big endian

spirit:field.spirit:name: RD_ENDIAN
spirit:field.spirit:description: read endian data being read from the card is in the following format. 1 = little endian 0 = big endian

spirit:field.spirit:name: AXI_NON_POST_WR
spirit:field.spirit:description: axi non-post write 1 = all axi master write requests are non-post write 0 = only the last request is issued as non-post write

spirit:field.spirit:name: PRIORITY
spirit:field.spirit:description: this is a static bit that is passed along as the most significant bit of the id when axi requests are made. this bit should be changed only before and after completion of a data command and not in between. 0x0 = low priority. 0x1 = high priority.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DMA_SIZE
spirit:field.spirit:description: fifo threshold this field is used for the fifo threshold for the internal fsm to generate a dma request to the axi master. 0x0 = 64 bytes 0x1 = 128 bytes 0x2 = 192 bytes 0x3 = 256 bytes

spirit:field.spirit:name: BRST_SIZE
spirit:field.spirit:description: dma burst size on the axi fabric 0x0 = 32 bytes burst 0x1 = 64 bytes burst 0x2 = 128 bytes 0x3 = 256 bytes

spirit:field.spirit:name: ARM_EMA
spirit:field.spirit:description: arm artisan sram extra time for memory read and write 000 is fastest and 111 is the slowest

spirit:field.spirit:name: ARM_EMAW
spirit:field.spirit:description: arm artisan sram delay for write operation by extendind the internal write pulse. 00 is fastest and 11is the slowest

spirit:field.spirit:name: ARM_EMAS
spirit:field.spirit:description: this field control extends the arm artisan sram pulse width of sense-amplifier enable signal. the default setting is low but when drive high, the pulse is extended.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ARM_RET1N
spirit:field.spirit:description: retention mode 1 enable, active low.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PRE_GATE_CLK_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: this field controls the amount of clock cycles that are provided before clock gating is enabled on the sd_clk io pad.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PDLVMC
spirit:field.spirit:description: this field controls some power down function for the internal 64x64 memory.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PDFVSSM
spirit:field.spirit:description: this field controls some power down function for the internal 64x64 memory.

spirit:field.spirit:name: FORCE_CLK_ON
spirit:field.spirit:description: force sd i/o pad clock on setting this field to 0x1 overrides the sd clock i/o pad clock gate and forces the clock on. this field is meant to be used in conjunction with the <ovrrd_clk_oen> field. bit [11] bit [12] setting 0 -- <force sd i/o pad clock on> setting is ignored (not used) 1 0 clocks are forced off 1 1 clocks are forced on

spirit:field.spirit:name: OVRRD_CLK_OEN
spirit:field.spirit:description: override pad clock output enable setting this field to 0x1 overrides the sd pad clock output enable. this field is meant to be used in conjunction with the <force_clk_on> field. bit [11] bit [12] setting 0 -- <force sd i/o pad clock on> setting is ignored (not used) 1 0 clocks are forced off 1 1 clocks are forced on

spirit:field.spirit:name: CLK_OE_USE_POS
spirit:field.spirit:description: 0 = use internal clock falling edge output(to eliminate clock signal tri-state issue) 1 = use internal clock rising edge output this field controls the sd/emmc bus clk pad output enable signal use clock rising edge output or use clock falling edge output note: if sw set rx160<31> = 1 means host will run at legacy mode, just use external phy as gpio, bus clock signal wil directly output to phy io by using test mode interfaces,at this condition, recommanded sw to clear this bit.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CLK_GATE_ON
spirit:field.spirit:description: clock gate on 0 = enable dynmical clock gate 1 = enable clock free running this field affects all clock gates in the sd design if the <clock gate ctl> field is set to 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CLK_GATE_CTL
spirit:field.spirit:description: clock gate ctl 0 = disable software clock gating override 1 = enable software clock gating override

spirit:field.spirit:name: USE_DAT3
spirit:field.spirit:description: this field allows the card detect functionality to be detected using the dat[3] pin. 0x0 = use dedicated pin. 0x1 = use dat[3].

spirit:field.spirit:name: SD1S_PDWN751
spirit:field.spirit:description: power down this bit controls the power down port on the internal 2 port 64x64 fifo.

spirit:field.spirit:name: FIFO_CS
spirit:field.spirit:description: fifo cs this field should be written to 0x1 before any toggling of the pdwn bit.

spirit:field.spirit:name: FIFO_CLK
spirit:field.spirit:description: fifo clock this field should be set to 0x1 before any toggling of the pdwn bit.

spirit:field.spirit:name: SD1S_WTC754
spirit:field.spirit:description: wtc this field is used for fifo speed setting.

spirit:field.spirit:name: SD1S_RTC755
spirit:field.spirit:description: rtc this field is used for fifo speed setting.

spirit:field.spirit:name: GEN_PAD_CLK_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: pad clock count this field should be used in conjunction with <gen_pad_clk_on> this field configures the number of clock cycles generated on the io pad. the default value of 0x4a will generate 75 clock cycles.

spirit:field.spirit:name: SPI_ERR_TOKEN
spirit:field.spirit:description: spi error token this is the spi error token received in command response when spi mode is enabled.

spirit:field.spirit:name: SPI_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: enable spi mode this field indicates that spi mode has been enabled. this will cause the host controller to drive the signals on the interface in accordance with spi protocol. 1 = spi mode enabled 0 = spi mode disabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: GEN_PAD_CLK_ON
spirit:field.spirit:description: generate pad clock this bit should be set in conjunction with the field <gen_pad_clk_cnt>. setting this bit to 0x1 will generate the programmed number of clock cycles on the io pad.

spirit:field.spirit:name: SQU_FULL_CHK
spirit:field.spirit:description: squ full check this bit should be set to 0x1 only if using certain piece of memory in squ in fifo mode and a "read" transaction is going to be performed on the sd device.

spirit:field.spirit:name: SQU_EMPTY_CHK
spirit:field.spirit:description: squ empty check this bit should be set to 0x1 only if using certain piece of memory in squ in fifo mode and a "write" transaction is going to be performed on the sd device.

spirit:field.spirit:name: BOOT_ACK
spirit:field.spirit:description: boot ack if the boot ack mode is enabled in the mmc device then this field should be written to 0x1 before issuing the alternate boot cmd0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: INAND_SEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: when driver program rx0c highest byte, the host dat/cmd line related registers will be reset. 0x1 = enable soft reset when trigger command. 0x0 = disable soft reset when trigger command.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ASYNC_IO_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: asynchronous read interface enable this bit enables the asynchronous latching of input data. 0x1 = async interface is enabled. the clock used to latch the input data and the internal logic clock are asynchronous. 0x0 = async interface is disabled.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PIO_RDFC
spirit:field.spirit:description: pio mode read operation fifo check. 0x0 = check all fifo data whether has been read done by cpu, if not, bus clock will stop and state will stop at block read beginning, then wait last block fifo data all has been read by cpu done, if done, the next block data will start to transfer(although use this method, the clock stop still not in block gap) 0x1 = don't check pio mode fifo whether has been read done by cpu. recommended sw setting this bit to 1 before use pio mode. in bus very high speed mode just as hs200/sdr104, sw must set this bit.

spirit:register.spirit:name: SDHC_LEGACY_CEATA_REG
spirit:register.spirit:description: SDHC LEGACY CTRL for CEATA Device Register

spirit:field.spirit:name: CPL_TIMEOUT
spirit:field.spirit:description: command completion signal timeout value

spirit:field.spirit:name: CHK_CPL
spirit:field.spirit:description: check command completion signal when this field is set to 0x1 and the <ce-ata card> field is set to 1, indication is sent to the host controller to check for command completion signal from the ce-ata card.

spirit:field.spirit:name: SND_CPL
spirit:field.spirit:description: send command completion disable signal when this field is set to 1 and the <ce-ata card> field is set to 1, indication is sent to the host controller to send the command completion disable signal to the ce-ata card.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CEATA_CARD
spirit:field.spirit:description: ce-ata card 1 = ce-ata card mode 0 = non ce-ata card mode

spirit:field.spirit:name: DAT_LEVEL793
spirit:field.spirit:description: mmc1_dat[7:0] line signal level this status is used to check the mmc_dat[7:0] line level to recover from errors and for debugging. this is especially useful in detecting the busy signal level from mmc_dat[0]. lower 4bits were same as rx26<7:4>

spirit:field.spirit:name: MMC_CARD
spirit:field.spirit:description: mmc card 1 = mmc card mode 0 = sd card mode

spirit:field.spirit:name: MMC_RESETN
spirit:field.spirit:description: mmc resetn this bit controls the value of the pin mmc_resetn going to the emmc device.

spirit:field.spirit:name: MMC_HS200
spirit:field.spirit:description: this bit is set when host read device_type[196] field of extended csd register in mmc card and card support hs200 mode, setting this before host clock changes to 200mhz, follow chapter6.6.4 on emmc4.5 spec. 1 = mmc hs200 mode enable. 0 = mmc hs200 mode disable, there has other backdoor registers to enable hs200 mode, please refer to rx3e registers.

spirit:field.spirit:name: MMC_HS400
spirit:field.spirit:description: this bit is set when host read device_type[196] field of extended csd register in mmc card and card support hs400 mode, setting this before host clock changes to 200mhz, follow emmc5.0 spec. 1 = mmc hs400 mode enable. 0 = mmc hs400 mode disable, there has other backdoor registers to enable hs200 mode, please refer to rx3e registers.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ENHANCE_STROBE_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: this bit control whether host/phy will use (delayed) strobe signal to sample the cmd response, this feature is for emmc5.1 spec enhance hs400 mode, sw should check the device related ext register to decide whether host/phy should support this feature.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CPL_COMPLETE
spirit:field.spirit:description: cpl_complete this bit is set to 1 when a command completion signal is detected and the <cpl_complete enable> field has been set to 1. this field is cleared by writing 0x1. a write of 0x0 has no effect.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CPL_COMPLETE_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: cpl_complete enable 1 = this bit when set to 0x1 will enable the cpl_complete bit to get set to 0x1 when a command completion signal is detected.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CPL_COMPLETE_INT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: cpl_complete interrupt enable 1 = an interrupt will be generated whenever the <cpl_complete> field is set

spirit:field.spirit:name: MISC_INT
spirit:field.spirit:description: misc_int this status bit is set to 1 when the programmed number of clocks in <gen_pad_clk_cnt> is completed and <misc_int_en> field has been set to 0x1. this field is cleared by writing 0x1. a write of 0x0 has no effect.

spirit:field.spirit:name: MISC_INT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: misc_int status enable 1 = this bit when set to 0x1 will enable the misc_int bit to get set to 0x1 when the programmed number of clocks have been generated on the pad.

spirit:field.spirit:name: MISC_INT_INT_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: misc_int interrupt enable 0x1 = an interrupt will be generated whenever the <misc_int> field is set to 0x1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TUNING_DLY_INC
spirit:field.spirit:description: when hw auto-tuning is being performed the host controller takes over the control of the delay value being programmed in the delay element. this field defines a value by which the delay value is incremented for each step.

spirit:field.spirit:name: SDCLK_DELAY
spirit:field.spirit:description: this field controls the delay value to the delay element.

spirit:field.spirit:name: SDCLK_SEL1
spirit:field.spirit:description: this field is used for rx data/cmd sample clock selections: this field controls the second mux selects. 0x0 = select clock from gpio pad feedback. 0x1 = select clock output from ddl, if for sw tuning, sw should set to 0x1 0x2, 0x3 = select internal clock.

spirit:field.spirit:name: SDCLK_SEL0
spirit:field.spirit:description: this field is used for sw tuning process. this field controls the first mux selects. 0x0 = select clock from pad. 0x1 = select inverted clock from pad. 0x2 = select internal clock. 0x3 = select inverted internal clock.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_MUX_SEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: tx output clock selection. 0x0 = select clock from inverter of base clock input 0x1 = select clock from ddll output clock

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_INT_CLK_SEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: tx output clock selection. 0x0 = select clock from the original inverter of base clock or ddll output clock 0x1 = select clock from inverter of internal work clock, will gurantee the hold time at default speed mode or high speed mode.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_DLINE_SRC_SEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: tx delayline clock source selection. 0x0 = select base clock as tx delayline input source clock 0x1 = select internal work clock as tx delayline input source clock, normally this bit only worked at hs200 mode, but if ddr mode need to do tx tuning, this tx delayline input clock source bit should be force to 0

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_HOLD_DELAY1
spirit:field.spirit:description: this field controls the delay value to the tx delay element for sdr104 mode.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_HOLD_DELAY0
spirit:field.spirit:description: this field controls the delay value to the tx delay element for all modes other than the sdr104 mode.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TUNING_CLK_DLY
spirit:field.spirit:description: this ro field indicates the final ddll delay counter value after tuning complete set, during tuning process this field will increase step by step, so normally no meaning to read it during hw tuning process.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TUNING_WD_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: this field controls the tuning success window width. if tuning success times >= tuning_wd_cnt, tuning is successful, then hw will choose middle of the window as the final tuning ddll delay counter value. default is 10 times as spec requirment, driver can adjust the total tuning count according to real condition.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TUNING_TT_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: this field controls the total tuning times, default is 40 times as spec requirment, driver can adjust the total tuning count according to real condition. total tuning count equals tuning_tt_cnt + 1

spirit:field.spirit:name: TUNING_HW_START_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: this field will let sw have the flexibility to config the hw auto-tuning start dll counter value.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TUNING_SUCCESS_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: this ro field indicates if hw auto-tuning failed, the cmd19 tuning success times. sw can read for references to decide whether adjust tuning step (tuning_dly_inc) or change the tuning window count (tuning_wd_cnt), this field only valid after tuning complete with fail. during tuning process, read this field is meaningless.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TUNING_HW_SDCLK_SEL1
spirit:field.spirit:description: this field is used for hw auto tuning, the meaning is like rx118<3:2> sw tuning definition.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TUNING_HW_SDCLK_SEL0
spirit:field.spirit:description: this field will let sw have the flexibility to config the hw auto-tuning dll source clock selection.

spirit:register.spirit:name: SDHC_ROUNDTRIP_TIMING_REG
spirit:register.spirit:description: SDHC ROUND TRIP(TRANSIMIT TO RECEIVE) TIMING PARAM Regsiter

spirit:field.spirit:name: DATA0BUSY_WAIT_CYCLES
spirit:field.spirit:description: this field controls host check data0 busy signal after how many cycles of the end bit of crc status in write operation, normally only hs200/sdr104/hs400 should use this field.

spirit:field.spirit:name: WRDATA0_WAIT_CYCLES
spirit:field.spirit:description: this field only valid when this register bit[2] or bit[1] or bit[0] be set at corresponding speed mode, if bit[1] or bit[0] be set, this field indicate the host controller internal logic data fsm should wait how many cycles between the bus driving direction turn around from data0 end bit to start bit of crc stauts when performance bus write operation

spirit:field.spirit:name: CMD2RESP_WAIT_CYCLES
spirit:field.spirit:description: this field only valid when this register bit[2] or bit[1] or bit[0] be set at corresponding speed mode, if bit[1] or bit[0] be set, this field indicate the host controller internal logic cmd fsm should wait how many clock cycles between the bus driving direction turn around from cmd end bit to response start bit.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TRS2RCV_PARAM_EN2
spirit:field.spirit:description: this field control whether at hs400 mode to enable sw to control the wait cycles should insert between cmd/data transmit to receive direction turn around period, in theory, hs400 mode need enable for phy output and input dll latency.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TRS2RCV_PARAM_EN1
spirit:field.spirit:description: this field control whether at ddr50/sdr50 mode to enable sw to control the wait cycles should insert between cmd/data transmit to receive direction turn around period

spirit:field.spirit:name: TRS2RCV_PARAM_EN0
spirit:field.spirit:description: this field control whether at hs200/sdr104 mode to enable sw to control the wait cycles should insert between cmd/data transmit to receive direction turn around period

spirit:field.spirit:name: SDHC_GPO
spirit:field.spirit:description: value needed to be driven to gpo pins; sw program these 16bits field, and the value will showed on gpo output ports on sdhc top module.

spirit:field.spirit:name: SDHC_GPI
spirit:field.spirit:description: value on gpi input ports; these 16bit fields were read-only attribute.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_DLINE_CODE
spirit:field.spirit:description: delayline dtc delay control signals, sw will program this field for tuning process, detailed delayline delay equation please check delayline documents.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_DLINE_CODE
spirit:field.spirit:description: delayline dtc delay control signals, sw will program this field for tuning process, detailed delayline delay equation please check delayline documents.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DLINE_PU
spirit:field.spirit:description: power-up signal: 0 =power down 1 = power up the time period from power up signal be set to the internal regulator output voltage be stable is about 100ns.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_DLINE_GAIN
spirit:field.spirit:description: tx delayline gain 2x set, this bit only worked at tx_dline_reg<6> be set 1 = extended delayline delay range and decreased resolution, normally for 100mhz frequency which still need use dll delayline. 0 = default(for 200mhz case)

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_DLINE_REG
spirit:field.spirit:description: tx delayline delay cfg register control signals, sw will program this field for tuning process, detailed delayline delay equation please check delayline documents.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_DLINE_GAIN
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx delayline gain 2x set, this bit only worked at rx_dline_reg<6> be set 1 = extended delayline delay range and decreased resolution, normally for 100mhz frequency which still need use dll delayline. 0 = default(for 200mhz case)

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_DLINE_REG
spirit:field.spirit:description: rx delayline delay cfg register control signals, sw will program this field for tuning process, detailed delayline delay equation please check delayline documents.

spirit:field.spirit:name: HOST_LEGACY_MODE
spirit:field.spirit:description: this field is backdoor register for sw to use old legacy topology host mode. by default, due to emmc5 phy/host topology changes, clock generation logic will moved into phy inside, phy will output working clock to host. if sw set this bit, below factors will be true: 1 host will use internal clock divider to generate clock 2 affect sw/hw rx tuning, host will use rx118/rx130 setting for dll slave delayline control, otherwise will keep use new added rx168 setting for dll slave delayline control. 3 host will treat phy just as gpio, only use phy test mode interface signals tdi/tdo/tdoe to output/input data/cmd/clk. 4 if sw set host _legacy_mode, recommended don't support hs400 mode, base clock frequency should better set <=200mhz and only up to hs200 mode 5 tbd, whether add backdoor delayline in rx/tx tuning path for clock tuning not used phy internal delayline 0x0 = host legacy mode disable, default use new external emmc5.0/sd phy topology 0x1 = host legacy mode enable.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PHY_DCHNL_STATUS
spirit:field.spirit:description: current phy 8 data channel enable status. on reset, hw logic will enable 1 bit mode data channle by default.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PHY_DCHNL_SW
spirit:field.spirit:description: sw programmed 8 data channels enable signals, every bit stands for 1 data channel, every bit value description is as below: 0x1 = this data channel is enable. 0x0 = this data channel is disable. note: cmd channel is always enable inside phy

spirit:field.spirit:name: PHY_DCHNL_SEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: phy 8 data channle sw enable selection. if sw want to control phy data channel function enable, should firstly set this bit and then set corresponding bits at bit[15:8]. 0x1 = phy data channel function enable will be controlled by sw programmed register bits at bit[15:8], if set this bit, sw should set bit[15:8] before use phy for data transfer. 0x0 = phy data channel function enable will be automatically controlled by host hardware logic, at this mode, sw can read bit[23:16] for current hw data channel control status, normally, for emmc protocol host hw will automatically set 8 data channel function enable at initialization phase;for sd protocol, hw will set 4 data channel function enable at initialization phase.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PHY_PLL_LOCK
spirit:field.spirit:description: when sw follow phy program sequence, after sw enable phy input source clock from apmu offset 0xe0, sw should also program this bit to 1, in order to let phy know the internal input 400mhz clock source is stable. 0x1 = phy 400mhz clock source input stable signal 0x0 = phy 400mhz clock source input instable

spirit:field.spirit:name: PHY_FUNC_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: phy function enable signal, phy will use this enable signal for internal circuit reset, if host core logic enter lower power mode, power gating(udr_latch) should keep phy_en = 0, for normal function, sw should set this bit before using phy and do other phy related setting before set this bit. 0x1 = phy function enable/phy power up 0x0 = phy function disable/phy enter lower power mode

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_USE_STROBE
spirit:field.spirit:description: from host, in fact is hs400 ddr mode rx_use_strobe = (uhs_mode[2:0] == 110b) | hs400_mode | enhance_strobe_en;

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_USE_DLYLINE
spirit:field.spirit:description: from host, in fact was hs200 or sdr104, host will also have a backdoor register(bit3) for setting this bit also in sdr50/ddr50(52) modes

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_USE_INVERT
spirit:field.spirit:description: this field be set when one of below two conditions meet: 1 rx3e<2:0> be set to all sdr mode. 2 rx118<30> = 0 be set, but rx118<30> set to 1 only affect phy test mode output put paths(tdo/tdoe) signals, all function output data/cmd and output enable signals will be controlled by phy logic.

spirit:field.spirit:name: HS200_USE_RFIFO
spirit:field.spirit:description: this bit control whether sw enable rfifo when running at hs200 mode: 0x0= disable rfifo in hs200(default hs200 mode use delayline output clock sample data and directly sampled again by host internal core clock) 0x1 = enable rfifo in hs200(if enable rfifo, delayline output clock sampled data will go to async fifo, then pop of fifo and go to host)

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_DIS_CKSTOP
spirit:field.spirit:description: due to phy addition, input data latency will be increased, host add this back door register to disable stopping clock behavior at middle of the data block when occurred fifo overflow conditions, only permitted stop clock at block gap. this field is actually a backdoor register for only sdr25/hs50/ddr50 or lower mode, since for hs200/hs400 higher mode spec claimed could not stop bus clock at middle of the data block.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PHY_TDI_SEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: this field control phy test mode input signal tdi source selection: 0x0= tdi will sampled by phy internal clock signal clock, normally this signal is same as host working clock (cclk_in) from phy. 0x1 = tdi directly from phy internal io pad di port.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_CKOUT_REVERSE
spirit:field.spirit:description: this field is backdoor register to control whether host controller reverse the output data phase: 0x0 = keep original design clock odd/even output phase, odd phase always 0, even phase = card_clk_en 0x1 = reverse odd phase data to even output port, reverse even phase data to odd output port

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_DDR_REVERSE
spirit:field.spirit:description: this field is backdoor register to control whether host controller reverse the output data phase: 0x0 = keep original design data odd/even output phase 0x1 = reverse odd phase data to even output port, reverse even phase data to odd output port

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_DDR_BKEN
spirit:field.spirit:description: back door register to control ddr mode rx direction whenever ddr50 mode, just force phy to use delayline output clock's both edge sample bus data in phy, and then output dqin_o[7:0] and dqin_e[7:0] to host, delayline's input clock is cki. 0x1 = back door mode is enable. 0x0 = back door mode is disable.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RFIFO_BYPASS
spirit:field.spirit:description: if set, host will bypass phy interface read fifo on hs400 mode, otherwise host will use the ck_rx_cmd directly sampled cmd in certain mode, normally need use rfifo in hs400 mode, since internal clock was async with phy output data/cmd rx clock. please be noticed that this bit only worked at hs400 mode, for tuning mode use free running clock case, data/cmd async read path can choose data async fifo put in host rx interface(use async_io_en, rx10c<1>)

spirit:field.spirit:name: CMD_USE_EVEN
spirit:field.spirit:description: this bit indicate when on enhanced hs400 mode whether cmd use 3/4t ds sampled signal as controller input, default use 1/4t ds sampled signal.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PHY_TEST_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description:
phy test mode enable signal, control pad output and output enable signals' source: if phy_test_en=1, test mode enable (phy bypass mode) - pad output is controlled directly by tdo (output data) and tdoe (output enable) from host normal function. this field has different meaning with rx160<31> host_legacy_mode, host_legacy_mode had strong effects, but this field only affect data/cmd/clk input/output paths. if sw set this bit, only item3 of rx160<31>=1 was taken effect, that means:

0x1= host will treat phy just as gpio, only use phy test mode interface signals tdi/tdo/tdoe to output/input data/cmd/clk.

0x0 = host will use emmc normal function data/cmd/clk paths. note: recommended sw to set this bit in bootrom for safety purpose. apmu also have backdoor register which can config phy enter bypass mode, but apmu regsiter be set will let tdo/tdoe from other mfpi function not emmc controller.and if sw want to use this mode, it assumed phy internal clock generation logic was ok and this bit be set not suit for ddr mode backup method, otherwise please use rx160<31> for using whole pure backup method(just only use phy's io pad)

spirit:field.spirit:name: PHY_MODE_STATUS
spirit:field.spirit:description: these 3bits reflect current phy working mode selection in host design, if phy_mode_swen = 1, this field value equal phy_mode_sw[2:0]; if phy_mode_swen = 0, this field value equal hw internal logic controlled signal phy_mode_hw[2:0].

spirit:field.spirit:name: PHY_MODE_SW
spirit:field.spirit:description: these 3bits only worked when sw set phy_mode_swen=1, sw can program these 3 bits to force host controller use "phy_mode_sw" field and ignore host internal hw generated mode selection signal "phy_mode_hw": 0x000 = mmc default speed mode(<=26mhz), sd ds/sdr12/sdr25(<=50mhz). 0x001 = mmc hs mode(<=50mhz,sdr protocol), sd mode sdr50 (<=100mhz) 0x010 = ddr50(or ddr52) 0x011 = hs200(or sdr104) 0x100 = hs400 0x101 = hs400 cmd enhanced mode all other values are reserved

spirit:field.spirit:name: PHY_MODE_SWEN
spirit:field.spirit:description: this bit give sw ability to control phy working mode selection, if set this bit, sw should synchronized set bit

spirit:field.spirit:name: DLL_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: enable dll. 0 = dll function disable(power down) 1 = dll function enable(power up)

spirit:field.spirit:name: DLL_DELAY_SRC
spirit:field.spirit:description: phy internal dedicated delayline input clock source selection. 0: delayline input clock default selected pclk(bus clock feedback) as source 1: give phy another option for change the delayline input clock source to phy internal cki(cclk_in), this option normally only worked at hs200 mode for host manually tuning method.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DLL_REFRESH_SW
spirit:field.spirit:description: 1 = sw ask to manually update dll_refresh signal 0 = sw just keep manually update signal dll_refresh as invalid.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DLL_REFRESH_SWEN
spirit:field.spirit:description: 1 = sw control dll_refresh manually update signal enable 0 = host hw control dll_refresh manually update signal

spirit:field.spirit:name: DLL_REFRESH_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: 1 = our host controller would generate dll_refresh signal manually adjust the delay of strobe signal; 0 = dll_rerresh signal will be always 0

spirit:field.spirit:name: DLL_STEP_CTRL
spirit:field.spirit:description: when hw auto-tuning is being performed the host controller takes over the control of the delay value being programmed in the delay element. this field defines a value by which the delay value is incremented for each step. note: due to new emmc5.x topology, dll slave delayline will be put into phy inside, so if use new phy topology, recommanded sw promgrammed this field, if worked at host_legacy_mode (rx160<31>=1), sw can just use old rx114 register to control hw/sw tuning process.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DLL_DELAY_CTRL
spirit:field.spirit:description: phy dll slave delayline tuning delay value control for hs400 mode if phy does not use internal dll master conunter value to update dll slave.this field only be worked at with dll_reg1<1>(rx168<1>) = 1. note: due to new emmc5.x topology, dll slave delayline will be put into phy inside, so if use old topology which worked at host_legacy_mode (rx160<31>=1) or for hs200/ddr50 tuninng, need use rx114/rx130/rx134 registers to control hw/sw tuning process.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DLL_VREG_CTRL
spirit:field.spirit:description: dll regulator output voltage control

spirit:field.spirit:name: DLL_FULLDLY_RANGE
spirit:field.spirit:description: dll delayline full delay range

spirit:field.spirit:name: DLL_PREDLY_NUM
spirit:field.spirit:description: dll delayline pre-delay numbers

spirit:field.spirit:name: DLL_BYPASS_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: dll master bypass enable for hs400 1 = dll master is bypassed, and dll_delay_ctrl directly controls the slave dll. 0 = dll on. use delay value from master dll.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DLL_REFRESH_METHOD
spirit:field.spirit:description: dll master code refresh method: 1 = always refreshed by ck_refresh synchronized to filter clock. 0 = before locked: refreshed by ck_refresh. after locked: refreshed by host generated dll_refresh rising edge.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DLL_REG3_CTRL
spirit:field.spirit:description: dll delay code offset

spirit:field.spirit:name: DLL_REG2_CTRL
spirit:field.spirit:description: dll loop parameter register. <7>: dll force lock <6>: sel_vote_tf (to be verified) <5>: bypass decimate filter <4>: reserved <3:2>: dll loop filter gain in locking process. <1:0>: dll loop filter gain in locked process default: 8h0c

spirit:register.spirit:name: SDHC_PHY_DLLSTS_REG
spirit:register.spirit:description: SDHC PHY DLL Status & reserved configuration Register

spirit:field.spirit:name: PHY_WORK_MODE
spirit:field.spirit:description: this field indicates current phy working mode flag, from phy output signal rdo_reg2<7:0>: <7>:sdr26 <6>: sdr52 <5>: ddr52 <4>: hs200 <3>: hs400 <2>: hs400_extd <1>: start_dll <0>: dll_error

spirit:field.spirit:name: DLL_REFRESH_STATE
spirit:field.spirit:description: this bit indicates dll manully refresh mode refresh signal state, this bit only valid when dll_refresh_en be set. 0: no refresh 1: manully refresh state, is from dll_refresh_hw(host hw control logic)

spirit:field.spirit:name: DLL_LOCK_STATE
spirit:field.spirit:description: this bit indicates whether master dll is at lock state or not. 0: unlock state 1: lock state

spirit:field.spirit:name: DLL_MASTER_DELAY
DLL_SLAVE_DELAY
spirit:field.spirit:description: this field relects the delay value currently used for strobe signal or used for sw/hw tuning process final delay value.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CLK_PU
spirit:field.spirit:description: clk pullup 2 bits resistor selection: 00 = high-z 01 = 50k ohms 10 = 40k ohms 11 =33k ohms

spirit:field.spirit:name: DS_PU
spirit:field.spirit:description: ds pullup 2 bits resistor selection: 00 = high-z 01 = 50k ohms 10 = 40k ohms 11 =33k ohms

spirit:field.spirit:name: CMD_PU
spirit:field.spirit:description: cmd pullup 2 bits resistor selection: 00 = high-z 01 = 50k ohms 10 = 40k ohms 11 =33k ohms

spirit:field.spirit:name: CLK_PD
spirit:field.spirit:description: clk pulldown 2 bits resistor selection: 00 = high-z 01 = 50k ohms 10 = 40k ohms 11 =33k ohms

spirit:field.spirit:name: DS_PD
spirit:field.spirit:description: ds pulldown 2 bits resistor selection: 00 = high-z 01 = 50k ohms 10 = 40k ohms 11 =33k ohms

spirit:field.spirit:name: CMD_PD
spirit:field.spirit:description: cmd pulldown 2 bits resistor selection: 00 = high-z 01 = 50k ohms 10 = 40k ohms 11 =33k ohms

spirit:field.spirit:name: SLEW_RATE
spirit:field.spirit:description: pad slew rate control: 00 = low 01 = medium 10 = high 11 = very high

spirit:field.spirit:name: DRIVE_SEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: for drive nominal impedance selection: 000 = high-z 001 = 200 010 = 100 011 = 66 100 = 50 101 = 40 110 = 33 111 = 33

spirit:field.spirit:name: DQX_PU
spirit:field.spirit:description: dq pullup resistor value selection, every two bits stands for one io selection: x stand for 7~0 00 = high-z 01 = 50k ohms 10 = 40k ohms 11 =33k ohms

spirit:field.spirit:name: DQX_PD
spirit:field.spirit:description: dq pulldown resistor value selection, every two bits stands for one io selection: x stand for 7~0 00 = high-z 01 = 50k ohms 10 = 40k ohms 11 =33k ohms

spirit:field.spirit:name: CLEAR_LB_ERR_STATUS
spirit:field.spirit:description: write 1 to clear sdhc_phy_lbsts_reg register

spirit:field.spirit:name: START_STUCK0_DET_CLK
spirit:field.spirit:description: after operation is finished, check emmc_lb_err_status register.

spirit:field.spirit:name: START_STUCK1_DET_CLK
spirit:field.spirit:description: after operation is finished, check emmc_lb_err_status register.

spirit:field.spirit:name: LB_TEST_TRIGGER
spirit:field.spirit:description: carry on loopback testing immediately. before seting this bit, host driver should program sdhc_phy_lbcnt_reg register (offset: 0x188). when sdhc_phy_lbcnt_reg register reaches 0, loopback testing will stop and this bit will be cleared automatically. only take effect when loopback mode enable is set.

spirit:register.spirit:name: SDHC_PHY_LBFUNC_REG
spirit:register.spirit:description: SDHC PHY LoopBack Function Configuration Register

spirit:field.spirit:name: LB_DS_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: this field stands for total latency from tx to rx through phy loopback path, sw should program this field to sync with phy's characters, recommended sw set this field to 5 in hs400 or hs200 with rfifo mode, other modes set to 4. note this field should be > 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: LB_FILTER_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: don't compare the first lb_filter_cnt data bits and the last lb_filter_cnt data bits when performing loopback testing

spirit:field.spirit:name: LB_CMD_MASK
spirit:field.spirit:description: if set, the corresponding path will not perform lookback test.

spirit:field.spirit:name: LB_DQ_MASK
spirit:field.spirit:description: if set, the corresponding path will not perform lookback test.

spirit:field.spirit:name: LB_INVERT_CLK
spirit:field.spirit:description: normally, when loopback test is triggered and data pattern starts to be driven, ckout_e will become 1 and ckout_o stays at 0. if this bit is set, ckout_e will become 1 and ckout_o stays at 0. only valid when bit[28] is set.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CLK_PASSTH_DS
spirit:field.spirit:description: loopback mode need host send clock control signal wr_ck_o/wr_ck_e/wr_ck_oe to phy 0: no need output clock control signals to phy, for hs400 mode use ds test, since ds in loopback comes from phy internal free running clock cki, so no need clock control signals. 1: for other working modes in loopback enable, should set this bit. wr_ck_oe in loopback mode will be 1t earlier than wr_ck_o/wr_ck_e

spirit:field.spirit:name: LB_PATTERN_SEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: 0: use programmable 32-bit pattern; 1: prbs7

spirit:field.spirit:name: LB_MODE_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: enter loopback mode. normally, host driver shall only change this bit when no other operation is ongoing.

spirit:register.spirit:name: SDHC_PHY_LBCNT_REG
spirit:register.spirit:description: SDHC PHY LoopBack Comparison Count Register

spirit:field.spirit:name: LB_COMP_CNT
spirit:field.spirit:description: this field records how many bits to be compared for current loopback testing. after loopback testing starts, host controller decrements this register until it reaches 0. please be noticed that after sw write this field, host will dynamically control this counter value, during loopback test process, this counter may changed cycle by cycle.

spirit:register.spirit:name: SDHC_PHY_LBSTS_REG
spirit:register.spirit:description: SDHC PHY LoopBack Error Status Register

spirit:field.spirit:name: LB_CLK_STUCK0_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: clk path is stuck at 0

spirit:field.spirit:name: LB_CLK_STUCK1_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: clk path is stuck at 1

spirit:field.spirit:name: LB_CMD_EVEN_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: if set, the cmd line path doesn't pass loopback testing

spirit:field.spirit:name: LB_CMD_ODD_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: if set, the cmd line path doesn't pass loopback testing

spirit:field.spirit:name: LB_DQ_EVEN_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: if set, the corresponding data path doesn't pass loopback testing

spirit:field.spirit:name: LB_DQ_ODD_ERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: if set, the corresponding data path doesn't pass loopback testing

spirit:register.spirit:name: SDHC_PHY_LBDATA_REG
spirit:register.spirit:description: SDHC PHY LoopBack DATA Pattern Configuration Register

spirit:field.spirit:name: LB_PATTERN_RST
spirit:field.spirit:description: reset data pattern fifo;

spirit:field.spirit:name: LB_PATTERN_WRITE
spirit:field.spirit:description: push a new data pattern into fifo;

spirit:field.spirit:name: LB_CMD_PATTERN
spirit:field.spirit:description: bit[17:16]:even/odd for cmd line;

spirit:field.spirit:name: LB_DATA_PATTERN
spirit:field.spirit:description: bit [7:0]: odd data pattern for data line bit[15:8]: even data pattern for data line

spirit:register.spirit:name: SDHC_PHY_LBDATA_REG
spirit:register.spirit:description: SDHC PHY LoopBack DATA Pattern Configuration Register

spirit:field.spirit:name: CQE_FSM_RST
spirit:field.spirit:description: a back door register which can let sw force cqe state machine goes to a stable idle state if hw meets some problems. write 1 means force cqe fsm into idle state. write 0 has no meaning.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CQE_DEBUG_SEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: these 4bits field indicate which internal 32bits debug bus signals will show on 0x1f4 register: [0000]: slot index & fsm informations [0001]: slot index informations [0010]: internal task slot fetch signals [0011]: internal task ready signals this field is for hw designer debug purpose.

spirit:register.spirit:name: CQE_CQBDCTRL_REG
spirit:register.spirit:description: SDHC Command Queue Debug Information Content Registers

spirit:field.spirit:name: CQE_DEBUG_INFO
spirit:field.spirit:description: 32bits debug signals information output to sw. please be noticed that these register value may changed cycle by cycle due to cqe hw internal design logic may still running during sw read this value. and see 0x1f0<3:0> to check which 32bits debug bus information will be selected output to this field.
